answers.answer: You may not be eating enough calories each day or you could have a thyroid disorder or insulin resistance.  Any one of those can slow metabolism and cause your body to hold onto extra weight.  You could also be retaining fluid for some reason.You need other kinds of veggies, besides green ones, too, though... try to eat every color there is - that's good for your husband as well.  Also make sure you add some healthy fats, such as coconut and olive oils, avocados, nuts, seeds, etc.  I lost 25 lbs cutting bread consumption in half and adding more fat to my diet. I have hypothyroidism, was pre-diabetic and had high cholesterol... I still have hypothyroidism that I take medication for, but I've reversed my pre-diabetes and brought my cholesterol levels back to normal and gotten off one of my blood pressure meds.Since you rarely eat bread, now, you have that battle won, already.

question: Hi ya'll I'm new to the group. I am 46 years old with 2 grown children I had 2 c sections and a hysterectomy 2 years ago. I have tried everything but just can't seem to lose weight. I don't drink soda or eat sweets (I don't like them) and because of my husbands diabetes I very rarely eat potatoes rice or bread and I am allergic to pasta so that is a never. My diet consists pretty much lean protein and green veggies. I try and walk 2+ miles 3 or more times a week. My question is What am I doing wrong???
title: Over 40 over weight
